midfielder d'ath leaves northampton to join luton .

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates have now finished for northamptonshire .
you can follow northampton town 's trip to bristol rovers in league one and northampton saints hosting bristol in rugby 's premiership on the bbc sport website .
we 'll be back on monday from 08:00 .
until then have a good evening and weekend .

documents.title: prof stephen hawking 'has made huge difference ' to perception of motor neurone disease
text: on sunday prof stephen hawking celebrates his 75th birthday .

prof hawking is director of research at the centre for theoretical cosmology within the university of cambridge , and also patron of the northampton-based mnd association , which supports people with motor neurone disease .
chris james from the mnd association said prof hawking had .
`` made a huge difference to people 's perception of motor neurone disease '' and that he raised awareness of the disease `` which we would n't have been able to achieve without him '' .

mr james said that prof hawking had `` achieved so much with his life and not been defined by his condition , but he is very unusual because a third of people die within a year of diagnosis and half within two years '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: overnight weather : feeling a tad warmer , with outbreaks of mainly patchy rain
text: it will be a cloudy , misty evening and night with outbreaks of generally light , patchy rain .
less cold air moving in behind the rain , so temperatures not dropping as low overnight .
minimum temperature : 3c ( 37f ) .
tomorrow rain will clear eastwards , but it 'll remain rather cloudy and rather gloomy .
top temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
get the full forecast where you live , from bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: police appeal for witnesses after serious sexual assault in kettering
text: police in kettering say a 43-year-old woman was seriously sexually assaulted in a churchyard in the early hours of new year 's day .
the woman was attacked close to the entrance of st andrew 's church on the corner of rockingham road and eskdaill street , some time between 04:30 and 05:00 .
a 25-year-old man from kettering has been arrested in connection with the offence and is currently in police custody , however , detectives would like to speak to any potential witnesses .
shortly before the attack , the woman is believed to have approached three men near the car park next to the swan pub in montagu street and told them she was being followed .
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: heseltine fined over cyclist crash
text: heseltine fined over cyclist crash

documents.title: lord heseltine fined £ 5,000 for knocking cyclist off bike on northamptonshire road
text: the former deputy prime minister lord heseltine has been fined £ 5,000 by magistrates after he admitted knocking a cyclist off his bike .
he appeared at northampton magistrates ' court yesterday and entered a guilty plea to a charge of careless driving .
the 83-year-old , driving a green jaguar , pulled out of a lane and into the path of the cyclist on the b4525 near thenford on 19 june last year .
the male cyclist was left with multiple injuries from the crash , including a broken arm , which was fractured in four places , and shattered knees which later required plates and pins .
lord heseltine was ordered to pay a £ 170 victim surcharge and £ 85 costs and was given five penalty points .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : 'the carla we love is no longer there '
text: the family of bedfordshire mother carla bramall have spoken about the anguish they go through seeing her in a care home after being diagnosed with alzheimer 's three years ago .
you can watch their heart-breaking story below .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: seeing daughter with alzheimer 's is 'heart-breaking '
text: for rita pepper , seeing carla bramall every day but realising her daughter no longer recognises her is `` heartbreaking '' .
rita , who now lives in rushden , northamptonshire , says since her daughter was diagnosed with alzheimer 's at the age of 36 she has seen her `` deteriorate so quickly '' .
carla , now 39 , `` can no longer lift her head , she ca n't walk or speak and needs to be fed with soft food '' she said .
carla 's children , who now live with their grandmother , no longer visit their mother as it is too upsetting for them .
she said : `` i thought by now there 'd be new treatments out there but there just is n't anything available that can slow down the progression .
`` i 'm desperate for as much research as possible to go into the disease .
it might be too late for carla but i will spend the rest of my life worrying about my grandkids , and i 'm not going to be around forever . ''
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: win your way to the fa cup final # peoplescup
text: sign up to the fa people 's cup and you could win your way on to the hallowed wembley stadium turf at half-time during the fa cup final .
entries are now open and you can find out all the details here .

documents.title: anguish for family after mother is diagnosed with alzheimer 's at 36
text: the family of a bedfordshire mother , diagnosed with alzheimer 's in her 30s , are campaigning to raise awareness of the disease .
carla bramall , 39 , from flitwick , no longer recognises her family , including her two children , and is in a care home .
the inherited form of dementia has already claimed the life of her father barry , her grandfather and her uncle , who were all in their 40s .
her cousin , who is a similar age to her , is also in a care home .
her brother lee bramall ( from rushden , northamptonshire , said : `` people need to recognise it happens to people in their 30s . ''
he believes carla started getting the disease at about 27 .
`` you think nobody at that age is going to get alzheimer 's , '' he said .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: local paper round-up : toxic smell , daventry arson , and 'smart corridor ' u-turn
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: midfielder d'ath leaves northampton to join luton
text: northampton town midfielder lawson d'ath has left the club and joined luton town for an undisclosed fee .
the 24-year-old joined the cobblers in 2014 and was part of last year 's league two championship-winning side , scoring four goals .
northampton town manager rob page said that d'ath 's opportunities club were `` limited '' and it `` makes sense for lawson to move on to play regular first-team football '' .
d'ath has signed a 18-month contract with the hatters .
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton Sport

documents.title: luton sign d'ath from northampton
text: luton sign d'ath from northampton

documents.title: cobblers return decision 'with toney '
text: cobblers return decision 'with toney '

documents.title: cobblers 'have done what they can ' to bring ivan toney back
text: northampton town chairman kelvin thomas has said the cobblers `` have done whatever we can to bring ivan toney back to the club and the decision is now with him '' .
the 20-year-old striker had been on loan from newcastle to league one rivals shrewsbury for the first half of the season , but returned to his parent club earlier this month .

toney , born and brought up in northampton , was sold to newcastle united by the cobblers in 2015 , and made two appearances in the permier league for the club , before going on loan to barnsley and helping the club achieve promotion to the championship .
toney scored six goals for shewsbury in league one this season , including two against northampton , in the cobblers ' 4-2 win .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: saints make just one change for visit of bristol
text: northampton saints take on bristol at franklin 's gardens tomorrow in rugby 's premiership and have made just one change with jamie elliott coming in for ken pisi on the wing .
wales wing george north once again starts after making his comeback from his head injury in the narrow victory at gloucester last week .
your saints are
are there still tickets please ?
yes .
@ twitterid they are all sinners apart from @ twitterid

documents.title: brexit positive but 'not all good ' says oundle boat-builder
text: adam greenwood of oundle-based english harbour yachts says that the impact from the brexit vote has been `` good but not all good '' on the company .
as the firm was preparing to its exhibition at the london boat show , he said the fall in the pound 's value had meant that parts , including motors , sourced from europe had become more expensive .
however , mr greenwood said since the vote `` the interest we are getting in europe has significantly improved '' .
the fall in the value of the pound has helped exporters , with a £ 2bn rise in exports in october , according to the office for national statistics .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: from 'not existing ' to the london boat show in under a year for fairline
text: the managing director of fairline yachts has said that exhibiting at the london boat show from today is a remarkable turnaround for the company .
russell currie said that this time last year `` we were not at london boat show , we had no staff - we did n't exist '' .
in december 2015 oundle-based fairline boats went into administration with 374 jobs lost .
its corby factory eventually closed , but just over a month later , the company was taken over by two russian investors and re-established at fairline yachts .
mr currie said it now had 227 staff at its oundle site and `` every single one of them '' felt like they had a stake in the company 's success .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: re-launched fairline yachts exhibits at london boat show
text: northamptonshire companies , including oundle 's fairline yachts , are exhibiting at the london boat show , which starts today .
fairline celebrates its 50th birthday this year but it was touch-and-go whether the luxury boat-builder would ever see its half-century .
following a series of job losses and restructurings , the company went into administration at the end of 2015 with 400 people were made redundant .
some were rehired when the company was bought and reborn as fairline yachts .
at the london boat show , fairline is exhibiting its range of yachts .
a new model is due to be launched later this month in germany .
another oundle-based company , english harbour yachts , is reporting renewed interest from overseas buyers since the fall in the value of the pound after the brexit vote .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: british grand prix : an analysis
text: for anyone who has followed formula 1 for the last decade or two , another story questioning the future of the british grand prix is about as surprising as cold weather in winter .
there is no doubt the british racing drivers ' club mean it when they say they are considering activating a break clause .

but , equally , there is no doubt that it fundamentally amounts to posturing - silverstone does not want to lose the british grand prix any more than do the 140,000 fans who went there to watch it last year .
the issue is the cost of the 17-year contract - £ 12m in 2010 ; a 5 % annual escalator means the race will cost nearly £ 17m this year and more than £ 26m by 2027 .
this is small by comparison with russia , which pays $ 50m ( £ 40.3m ) a year .
it 's not that far out of line with the new deal signed by italy for €68m ( £ 58m ) over 2017-19 , which averages out at £ 19.3m a year .
but silverstone - almost alone among grands prix - receives no government funding of any kind .
no other circuit in britain is even remotely close to being able to replace it - so ignore any suggestions from f1 boss bernie ecclestone to that end .

the solution lies in new f1 owner liberty media , which has made it abundantly clear it wants to retain and nurture the historic european races , home of the sport 's core audience , as a bedrock of its new-look f1 .
liberty will complete its takeover deal before the end of the first quarter of this year .
so expect some time between then and this year 's british grand prix on 16 july a compromise deal that revises the terms of the contract and secures the race 's future .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: british grand prix : sir jackie stewart calls on government to support silverstone
text: sir jackie stewart has called on the government to give more financial support to the silverstone circuit , saying that if britain wants success like it has seen at the olym including london 2012 , formula 1 needs similar financial support .
he told bbc radio northampton : `` formula 1 and the british grand prix has been very little supported , if any , by the government .
when you think of the amount of people involved in the british motorsport industry is 140,000 people , we could lose that industry . ''

sir jackie , a three-time world champion , said that if silverstone were to stop hosting the grand prix it would be an `` enormous loss '' and added : `` i do n't think we should be allowing this to happen . ''
however , he concluded : `` with negotiations and discussion with the time that 's left [ before 2019 break clause ] we should be able to keep the grand prix [ at silverstone ] . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: british grand prix : 'nothing we can do ' , says ecclestone
text: silverstone first hosted the british grand prix in 1950 and has been the event 's permanent home since 1987 .
formula 1 chief bernie ecclestone told itv news : `` if they want to activate a break clause , there is nothing we can do .
`` two other tracks have contacted us and we are keen to keep a british grand prix ; there is no doubt about it , we want to have one . ''

back in 2009 the race was going to move from silverstone to donington park , but after the leicestershire circuit was unable to secure funding , silverstone stepped in and then signed the contract to host the race until 2026 , with the break clause in 2019 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: british grand prix : silverstone race 'under threat because of costs '
text: the future of the british grand prix at silverstone could be under threat because of the `` potentially ruinous risk '' of staging the loss-making race .
circuit owner the british racing drivers ' club ( brdc ) is considering giving notice to exercise a contract-break clause at the end of 2019 .
a letter written by brdc chairman john grant - seen by itv news - says a decision will be made by `` mid-year '' .
the brdc 's contract with formula 1 runs until 2026 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: regional weather : frosty start , rain coming later
text: it will be a cold , bright start although there will be patchy fog in some places early on , but it will cloud over later with rain arriving this afternoon in the west and towards the evening in the east .
maximum temperature : 5c ( 41f ) .
for more details , visit bbc weather .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning .
it 's another cold one .
so cold my car would n't start and i 'm currently on a bus into northampton .
but that wo n't stop us bringing you the latest news , weather , sport and travel for northamptonshire .
we 've got news this morning of the future of the british grand prix at silverstone and we 'll look ahead to the weekend 's sport .
first though , the weather forecast .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates have now finished for northamptonshire until friday .
tomorrow we 'll be building up to a busy weekend of sport and looking at the county boat builders at the london boat show .
any breaking news will appear here through the evening and overnight and we 'll see you tomorrow from 08:00 .

documents.title: weather : cold and foggy overnight
text: there 's a chance of an isolated shower near the coast , but otherwise it 'll stay dry but damp in places across the bbc east region .
there will be a widespread frost with mist and freezing fog patches overnight as the temperature dips to a minimum of -2c ( 28f ) , but it will be warmer towards the coast .
friday will see freezing fog gradually lifting , although it may linger throughout the morning .
some bright spells developing , but turning cloudier through the day with the chance of patchy rain later and high of 4-6c ( 39-43f ) .
there are more details for where you are on the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: extra officers and advice for vehicle owners after 14 crimes in last two days
text: police in daventry have said there has been a `` surge '' in vehicle crime over the last two days with three crimes in the town and 11 in the surrounding villages .
they have issued advice to car owners and also those with commercial vans .
the advice includes not leaving items on display including carrier bags , change and charging cables for phones and sat-navs .
they also suggest those with vans should get a movement detection alarm .
northamptonshire police say there will also be extra officers patrolling the area .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: players 'wo n't duck into high tackle ' to get players sent off says day
text: northampton saints forward and rugby players ' association chairman christian day said he does n't think it would be possible for players to `` duck into a tackle , looking to get a high tackle '' .

in a statement phil winstanley , rugby director at premiership rugby , praised the changes as a `` step forward '' for the sport , while world rugby has said the rules `` ensure the head is a no-go area '' for players .
premiership rugby also said the changes will be supported by a `` global education programme '' .
day said : `` you 're introducing this ideology to the players , that if you get hit towards the head you might just stay down an extra five seconds and make sure the ref has a think about that .
`` that 's something that rugby 's always prided itself on , that we 're not going to do . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: rugby players ' association chairman criticises tackling laws change
text: rugby players ' association chairman christian day has criticised changes to rules over high tackles .
the new laws , which mean players making contact with the head in `` reckless tackles '' receive at least a yellow card , came into effect on 3 january .
the rules also mean penalties are given , even when contact is accidental .
`` you 've seen the issues we 've had - players being sent off , games being changed as a result of clumsiness , '' northampton lock day , 33 , told our saints show .

`` these laws are coming in for our own welfare , our own safety , and as a player you 've got to look at that with an open point of view and think someone 's doing this to try to make the game as safe as possible .
`` but to make such massive changes mid-season - with very little explanation , education and everything that should come with it - is n't a good idea . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: diana letter sells for thousands
text: it seems like the sale of princess diana 's letters are proving very popular as as letter explaining prince harry was `` constantly in trouble '' at school has sold for £ 2,400 .
correspondence describing william 's reaction to harry 's birth has just sold for £ 3,200 - that 's £ 2,600 over the estimated price .
# diana letter saying harry constantly in trouble at school !
estimate £ 900 actual £ 2400 on telephone
author: Sarah Campbell
BBC News/Royal Correspondent

documents.title: day criticises high tackle law changes
text: day criticises high tackle law changes

documents.title: worldwide interest in diana letters
text: it seems like the auction of the letters of diana , princess of wales is getting a lot of interest from around the world .
ex-buckingham palace steward cyril dickman 's collection is going under the hammer at the cheffins auction house in cambridge shortly .
live @ twitterid diana letters written to cyril dickman inc naughty schoolboy harry !
buyers from us , japan , germany poised @ twitterid
hi sarah , great to see your report from the auction on the lunchtime news , wishing you a wonderful & happy new year x
author: Sarah Campbell
BBC News/Royal Correspondent

documents.title: local paper round-up : armed police could return , tributes to corby 's 'mr scotland ' and more
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :

documents.title: afternoon weather : fine and sunny , but staying cold
text: any showers will fade this afternoon , leaving a dry and sunny day for all , but it will remain cold with a high of just 4c ( 39f ) .
find more detail for where you are at bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: how does the greyhound derby compare to it 's horse racing counterpart
text: from this year the english greyhound derby will be at towcester racecourse .
it has one of the biggest prize funds in the sport , but it lags behind horseracing 's derby .
but how does that compare with horse racing 's epsom derby
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: racecourse aiming to be 'one of the world 's premier greyhound tracks '
text: kevin ackerman , the chief executive of towcester racecourse says that the english greyhound derby `` really does have a huge weight in the world of greyhound racing '' .
he said the race , which the track has secured the rights to for the next five years , will `` propel [ towcester ] to the position of one of the world 's premier greyhound tracks '' .
the track has only been open since december 2014 , and mr ackerman says the progress they 've made in that time is `` testament to work that 's been put in by the staff '' .
he said that , along with the derby , they 'll be soon launching saturday morning racing for the australian tv market , which `` puts us into a very strong position '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: english greyhound derby moving to towcester
text: towcester racecourse has signed a deal to stage one of greyhound racing 's most prestigious events .
the english greyhound derby will be held at the south northamptonshire track for the next five years .
the derby was first staged in 1927 and has one of the biggest prize-funds in the sport .
it was first held at white city stadium in london , moving to wimbledon stadium in 1985 and it will have its first running at towcester later this year .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: unused rockingham road 'not that terrible ' say football club 's supporters
text: many kettering town fans would like to see the club return to rockingham road , but the ground has been unused for over five years , has been left derelict and been partially damaged by fire .

however , richard atkinson from the kettering town supporters trust says that `` a lot of what you see that is bad about rockingham road is on the surface - it looks terrible , but it is not that terrible '' .
however , mr atikinson said that `` it 's not going to be cheap and it 's not easy , but the real problem is getting hold of it in the first place '' .
the supporters trust has twice failed to get rockingham road listed as a asset of community value , meaning the land could be used for nothing other than football .
the land at rockingham road has also previously been earmarked for housing by the council .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: supporters will 'keep trying ' to get club back to old ground
text: richard atkinson from the kettering town supporters trust say their preferred option for a ground in kettering itself would be the club 's former home of rockingham road and they would `` keep trying that as long as we can '' .
kettering played at rockingham road ( from their creation in 1872 , until 2011 .
mr atkinson said another option would be land at weekley glebe in kettering which `` makes a lot of sense to a lot of people '' .
he said that kettering borough council has `` agreed to talk to the club '' about all options for the ground .
mr atkinson said the club could stay at latimer park `` but it 's not in kettering '' and they have `` got to discount all the options before latimer park '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: poppies fans urged to 'show the council ' the support for new stadium
text: kettering town play basingstoke town at latimer park this saturday and the southern premier division match is being used by poppies supporters to show their support for the club - and their campaign for a stadium in the town centre .
they 're calling saturday `` show your support day '' .
richard atkinson , from the supporters trust , said the day gives the club `` a chance to show the council what support there is for getting the club back to kettering '' .
the latimer park ground is outside the town and across the a14 in burton latimer .
mr atkinson said they `` do n't know what to expect '' in terms of attendance , but are hoping to get more that the season high of 656 on boxing day and would `` love to get over 1000 '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: royal letters describe how prince william 'adores his little brother '
text: diana , princess of wales ' letters are being sold by the family of the late cyril mr dickman , who was head buckingham place steward for more than 50 years .
they describe how a young prince william `` swamped '' his new baby brother harry , with `` an endless supply of hugs and kisses '' .
photos , christmas cards and cake from the queen 's wedding will also go under the hammer .
the letters form part of about 40 lots from mr dickman 's former estate , which is due to be sold .
cheffins , a cambridgeshire auction house , said the letters formed part of `` a unique collection of royal memorabilia '' .

documents.title: diana letters about william and harry to be sold at auction
text: letters written by diana , princess of wales , are expected to fetch about £ 1,500 when they go under the hammer in cambridge today .
the letters are mainly focused on prince william and prince harry and explain how harry was `` constantly in trouble at school '' .
the sale at cheffins , gets underway at 11:00 .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: today 's weather : sunny and cold
text: after a frosty start , today is due to be dry and sunny , and cold with a maximum temperature of 4c ( 39f ) .
tonight will also be dry and cold night , with a widespread frost forming and the risk of fog developing .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: hello there .
we are back with live updates for northamptonshire .
there 's all the days news , including a look at greyhound racing at towcester racecourse .
then there 's the sport , with news on the cobblers and the saints , and how kettering town are hoping for a big crowd this weekend .
plus any major travel disruption , and coming up in a moment the weather forecast .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from us here at local live for northamptonshire .
we 'll be back with regular updates from 08:00 on thursday with all your news , sport , travel and weather .
we 'll also be discussing internet safety for young people .
and with a frosty night ahead , how best to defrost your car !

documents.title: weather : dry this evening with long clear spells
text: staying mainly dry this evening with long clear spells but a risk of a few showers blowing in from the north sea which may have a fleeting wintry flavour .
feeling cold in the breeze overnight and a sharp frost will develop bringing a risk of ice .
thursday will start cold but long spells of sunshine are expected although showers are possible across northern and eastern counties .
maximum temperature : 6c ( 40f ) .
more details from bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: hospitals under pressure
text: northampton general hospital has more acute patients in its care today than in its entire history .
both kettering general hospital and northampton general hospital are also under considerable emergency care pressures and looking after large numbers of patients .
the hospitals have declared a `` black alert '' status , urging people not to go to a & e unless it 's a life-threatening emergency .
between 19 december and 1 january , 3,318 people attended kettering general hospitals emergency department - .
6.2 % more people than the same time last year .
yesterday , 287 patients arrived in a & e - which is much higher than even this winter 's average of 237 .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: northampton town fan given five-year ban for throwing flare into crowd
text: a northampton man has been issued with a five-year football banning order following his involvement in throwing a flare into the crowd during a cup match between northampton town and manchester united .

jake marriott , 19 , of croughton close , was found guilty of being in possession of a flare at sixfields stadium on 21 september when northampton town hosted manchester united in the third round of the football league cup .
ch supt mick stamper , who leads on policing football matches in northamptonshire , said : marriott was seen to throw a flare at a crowd during the match and was arrested on the night . ''
officers applied for the civil banning order after receiving evidence to show that marriott was also in marseille in june when disorder broke out during euro 2016 .
he was given a 12-week custodial sentence , suspended for two years , ordered to complete 120 hours unpaid work and to pay £ 615 court costs , police said .
the banning order restricts marriott from attending any regulated football match within the uk .
it also restricts his travel outside of the uk when the england football team are playing abroad .

documents.title: pc sacked over unpaid train ticket
text: pc sacked over unpaid train ticket

documents.title: greyfriars redevelopment 'progressing well '
text: plans to build on the old greyfriars site are `` progressing well '' , northampton borough council says .
a planning application is expected to be submitted this summer by the developers carter endurance , operating as greyfriars developments ltd .
proposals are likely to include a hotel and cinema , as well as restaurants and a residential area .
but as we look at the future let 's remind ourselves of that moment when the greyfriars building , which dominated the northampton skyline for nearly 40 years , was demolished in may 2015 .

documents.title: weather update : sunny but temperatures set to drop
text: good news - we 've a largely dry and sunny afternoon in store with a maximum temperature of 7c ( 45f ) , but it 's set to get chilly later on with a widespread frost .
you can get the details forecast where you live from bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'i 'm worried brexit may never happen ' , says leave mp
text: one of the leading campaigners to leave the european union has accused members of `` the establishment '' of trying to scupper plans for brexit .

peter bone , the mp for wellingborough who helped set up the grasroots out movement , told bbc look east that he was worried some of those who supported remain were trying to indefinitely delay things .

interviewed before the resignation of sir ivan rogers , our ambassador in brussels , he said : `` we are up against the establishment and we know there are certain people who have made it clear that they do n't accept the result and they want to play the long game .
`` the longer before we exit the eu there 's more of a chance of some event occurring which would stop it or put it off . ''
when asked if he is worried that brexit may never happen he says `` i am '' .
he goes on to say that he 's confident theresa may is capable of pushing through the plans , but he 'll be watching closely for any delays .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: pc sacked for failing to pay £ 15.60 rail ticket
text: a northamptonshire police officer has been sacked for failing to pay for a rail ticket worth £ 15.60 .
pc frances tilley admitted she 'd `` destroyed her career '' after evading payment for a journey between bristol temple meads station and castle cary in somerset .
a disciplinary hearing at wootton hall police headquarters today heard she was less than two years into her job - and was still on probation .
she was dismissed by chief constable simon edens for gross misconduct .
the hearing was told that pc tilley travelled from northampton to castle cary on 22 june last year , but did not have a valid ticket for the last stretch of the journey .
she was described as `` diligent , professional and committed '' and apologised at the hearing .
finding allegations of gross misconduct proven , mr edens said : `` in your own words , you have destroyed your career and your future . ''
he added : `` it 's simply unacceptable that a police officer can not be trusted because of our unique role in society and we must be relied upon to tell the truth . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police name the man who died in new year 's day crash
text: a 24-year-old man who died after his car came off the road on new year 's day has been named by police .
tom moss , of scott road , corby , was killed when his blue volvo convertible hit a tree on the a4300 between geddington and stanion about 01:00 .
mr moss was taken to kettering general hospital but later died .

documents.title: disruption for motorists in northampton town centre
text: motorists in northampton town centre will start seeing signs going up today giving details of road closures for major road works taking place over the next three months .
national grid is beginning a vital gas mains replacement project and the first road to be closed will be horseshoe street .
about 180m ( 590ft ) of ageing gas mains are being replaced with new tough , hard-wearing plastic pipes with a lifespan of at least 80 years .
there will be access to homes and businesses , but there will be lane closures and diversions in place until april .

documents.title: robbers steal cash from rothwell shop
text: two men have stolen money from a till at the co-operative supermarket in rothwell .
it happened at about 14:30 on tuesday .
one of two men , who had been in the queue at the store in bell hill , bought a disposable lighter .
while paying for it , both men leaned over and tried to take the till .
they failed , but managed to steal some money before running from the store .
author: Carroll Weston
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'an hour 's training to drive an ambulance ' is 'impossible ' , east midlands ambulance service saysnorthants
text: the east midland ambulance service nhs trust has said it would be impossible to train someone properly to drive under blue lights in one hour .

it comes after the victoria derbyshire programme learned that some staff at a private ambulance firm which provides emergency cover for the east of england ambulance service , said they had only an hour 's training .
dave bradley from the trust told the programme : `` everything on the road or on the side of the road is a potential hazard to us .
`` our driver 's course is four weeks long , the first two weeks is the foundation , then the blue light driver training takes another two weeks . ''
author: James Melley
BBC News

documents.title: a43 northamptonshire update
text: a43 overstone roundabout by the shell petrol station .
rtc car vs lorry .
long delays at the moment as the road is blocked .
please avoid
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: greyfriars development progress to be discussed
text: a planning application for the new mixed-use development at greyfriars is expected to be submitted this summer , with the potential for work to start on the site early in 2018 , northampton borough council has said .
a decision to work with carter endurance , operating as greyfriars quarter developments ltd , as the preferred developer of the site was taken in september 2016 .

since that time , the company has been in discussion with potential operators for the hotel and cinema , as well as talking to a housing association about the proposed rented element of the scheme.modelling the effect of the development on traffic on the surrounding roads is also continuing , with results expected back in late february .
a progress report on the development will be discussed at a meeting on northampton borough council 's cabinet on 11 january .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : mostly dry and cloudy with some sunshine later
text: becoming mostly cloudy through the morning with a little patchy rain .
this will clear during the afternoon with some sunshine breaking through but it 'll feel cold .
temperatures will fall quickly during the evening with frost forming .
maximum temperature : 7c ( 45f )
more from bbc weather :
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from northamptonshire
text: hello and welcome back to our live stream of news across northamptonshire .
between now and 18:00 the team here will bring you the news , sport , travel and weather updates as we get them .
we 'll bring you a full weather forecast shortly .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: thanks for your company .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow with the latest news , travel , weather and sport updates but any breaking news will be posted here overnight .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: weather : cloudy and dry overnight
text: it 'll be slightly warmer than last night with cloudy skies , but on the whole a mainly dry night across the bbc east region , with some clear intervals .
temperatures staying above freezing at 2c ( 36f ) .
wednesday will start cloudy with the risk of light rain or drizzle moving in from the north but drier and brighter later with sunny spells and a top temperature of 6c , 43f .
weather has more local details .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: children meet the kettering robot
text: we 've been looking at the strange story of the kettering robot after finding an intriguing archive photo .
we 've found another one , too : this of children in the town staring in amazement at the walking , talking creation in january 1939 .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: call for street lighting on busy northampton road
text: there are calls for a busy road in northampton to have street lighting installed .
labour county councillor for darlington spencer ward , gareth eales , said parts of mill lane - which runs between the cock hotel in kingsthorpe , and bants lane in duston - are `` dangerous '' .
`` the level of concerns raised with me has been fairly consistent , '' he said .
much of the road has a 40mph speed limit which means northamptonshire county council does not have to provide street lights .
ian morris , the county councillor responsible for lighting , said : `` we will always look at each individual case on its merits . ''
he said the county had received `` very few complaints '' .
mr morris said : `` councillor eales may have seen lots of complaints but they are not filtering through to us . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: two 77-year-olds attacked after pool table row in wellingborough
text: two men , both aged 77 , have been assaulted in pub in wellingborough following a confrontation over the use of a pool table .
the men were assaulted inside the volunteer pub , in midland road , on new year 's day after another man playing pool was questioned about the `` appropriate use of the table '' .
`` one of the men ( playing pool ) broke a pool cue in half and attacked the two victims , '' said northamptonshire police .
`` one of the victims suffered a cut to his forehead and a black eye .
both victims were left shaken following the attack . ''
both men then ran from the pub , with the offender still holding on to the pool cue .
he was seen heading up victoria street towards cannon street .
the offender is described as white , about 30 years old , 6ft 3in ( 1.9m ) tall and of slim build .
he had a goatee beard and short dark hair that was spiked at the front .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: one from the archives : kettering robot unveiled in 1939
text: seventy eight years ago this month , charles lawson , an electrical engineer of kettering , was photographed lighting his robot 's cigarette .
little seems to be known about the robot and its capabilities , but we 're trying to find out more information .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: by-election after corby councillor absent for six months
text: a by-election has been called on corby borough council because the sitting councillor has failed to attend a meeting for six months .
ken carratt represented kinsgwood and hazel leys ward .
in november he left the labour group , and became an independent councillor .
his seat has now been declared vacant and the by-election will be held on 9 february .

documents.title: deenethorpe garden village plans backed
text: plans for a new village with 1,500 homes in northamptonshire have been welcomed by a local councillor .

yesterday , we reported that deenethorpe was one of 14 successful bids to create so-called garden villages across england , which the government said would help to provide badly-needed extra housing .
the site , between corby and oundle , is a former world war two bomber base and developers will have access to government money .

local councillor and east northamptonshire council planning committee chairman phil stearn said : `` we get lots of applications which are bigger than this and smaller than this but this is the most exciting because it ticks all the boxes .
`` the government gets a lot of houses built in the right areas rather than just attaching them to towns .
`` i represent oundle and we 're having to put new houses on the outskirts to meet government targets .
but here at a stroke there 's 1,500 houses with very few problems .
it 'll have all the infrastructure that it needs . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: taxi driver robbed in northampton
text: a private hire taxi driver was robbed at knifepoint in ecton brook road , northampton , early on new year 's day .
the 44-year-old man stopped near to knights brook pharmacy to up a passenger at about 07:00 on sunday , when he was approached by a group of four white men , wearing stockings over their faces .
three of the men got into the back of the car while the fourth got into the front and threatened the driver with a knife .
they demanded cash , which was handed over , and then ran off .
officers would like to speak to anyone who may have any information .

documents.title: robbery at duston salon
text: a hair salon in northampton has been robbed by a man carrying what is believed to have been a handgun .
it happened at the john billington salon , on ashwood road , duston , at about 17:00 on new year 's eve .
the man threatened a member of staff and a customer , and demanded cash and the customer 's handbag .
he is described as black , in his mid-20s , wearing dark clothing , and carrying a black nylon drawstring bag .

documents.title: man dies in crash between geddington and stanion
text: a man has died following a road traffic accident in the north of the county .
the victim , who was 24 , was the driver of a car , which left the road and hit a tree on the road between geddington and stanion , in the early hours of new year 's day .
he was taken to kettering general hospital , where he died .
police want to hear from any witnesses to the crash .

documents.title: archive fangio and moss at silverstone , 1954
text: sixty-three years ago this photograph was taken at silverstone .
it shows argentinian driver juan manuel fangio in the mercedes on the right , competing against british driver stirling moss .

documents.title: the fa people 's cup is back - sign up now ! # peoplescup
text: looking for a new project for the start of 2017 ?
how about getting fit/fitter with a chance to win free tickets to the fa cup final ?

get inspired has again teamed up with the football association to launch the 2017 fa people 's cup , a free knockout competition that will give the people of england the chance to play in their version of the fa cup .
from sunday league regulars to folk who have only kicked a ball in their back yard everyone can take part .
find out more and sign up here .

documents.title: children having 'three cubes of sugar ' at breakfast
text: one in five reception-year children in northampstonshire is overweight , rising to one in three by the age of 11 , according to new figures from public health england .
the organisation says it 's concerned at the amount of sugar being eaten by children , especially at breakfast time .
orla hugeniot , senior campaign nutritionist at public health england , said children were having `` too much sugar '' .
she said : `` children are having roughly around 11g of sugar at breakfast time alone .
`` that 's almost three cubes before they start the day '' .
last year it was revealed that children as young as two were going into hospital and having all of their teeth removed because of decay .
the recommended daily maximum is no more than five cubes of sugar for four- to six-year-olds and no more than six cubes for seven- to 10-year-olds per day .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cobblers start new year on back foot
text: it was n't a happy new year for northampton town , who kicked off 2017 with a 2-1 home defeat to bradford city .
both teams were hoping to get their seasons back on track after poor runs of form , but neither was able to carve out many clear-cut opportunities in a scrappy first half .
the greater threat was carried by northampton who struck first to take a lead into half-time .
however , city dominated the second half and eventually equalised on 73 minutes , before securing a winner to secure the their first league victory since november .
the loss leaves northampton 16th in league one .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : sunny intervals but feeling cold in breeze
text: after a frosty start with some icy patches possible , a dry day with more cloud around than yesterday but it will feel cold in brisk breeze .
some sunny periods are also likely but it 'll feel cool - although not as cold as monday .
maximum temperature : 6c ( 43f )
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: happy new year
text: good morning , happy new year and welcome to live updates for northamptonshire on tuesday , 3 january 2017 .
we 'll be here until 18:00 today with the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the county .
you can get in touch with the team here by email , twitter or on facebook .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live
